item.title: Creating Custom Configuration in Quarkus Loaded from JSON File
item.description: Introduction Quarkus, a framework for building lightweight, fast, and efficient Java applications, offers developers the flexibility to create custom configurations loaded from JSON files. These custom configurations can be seamlessly integrated into your Quarkus application, enhancing its configurability and adaptability. To achieve this, Quarkus utilizes Eclipse MicroProfile Config ( MP-Config), with the SmallRye implementation providing the necessary tools. In this article, we’ll delve into the process of crafting custom configurations and loading them from JSON files within Quarkus, all while exploring the mechanics of SmallRye’s MP-Config implementation.
